file.title: BOM and DOM Introduction
file.h2: In web developments we have two very important concepts. The BOM and the DOM.
file.bullet:
The BOM is the Browser Object Model
It allows us to interact with the browser.
The BOM represents the browser as a tree of nodes and objects. That way, programming languages can control the browser and get information from it.
The Window is the root element of the BOM tree.

The DOM is the Document Object Model
It allows us to interact with the webpage.
The DOM represents the document (web page) as a tree of nodes and objects. That way, programming languages can control the page and get information from it.
The Document is the root element of the DOM tree.
In this section we will build on all the JavaScript you know thus far, and use JavaScript to add interactivity to our HTML and CSS.
We'll learn about the Browser Object Model (BOM)
We'll learn about the Document Object Model (DOM)
We'll learn how to use both to write JavaScript that modifies HTML and responds to events triggered by users.
We'll recognise the creator of the BOM and DOM.
